1/ Use the present tense as if it were already a reality. "I am confident."
2/ Be positive by focusing on what you want, not on what you want to avoid.
3/ Choose words that are meaningful to you.
4/ Be clear.
5/ Strengthen your affirmations with concrete examples from your life that confirm them: "I am organized because I plan my days and finish my projects on time."

Imagine that at your birth, your brain is like a dense jungle. Moving through this jungle is difficult. When you have a thought for the first time, it‚Äôs like opening a new trail in the jungle. The more you think that thought, the easier it becomes to follow this trail, and the more you use this trail, the more you think that thought. Gradually, this trail becomes a path, then a road, and eventually an expressway.

Changing your belief system is like carving a new path in the jungle. Your brain, for energy efficiency, prefers to use the neural highway it has patiently created. So, it takes a conscious effort to create this new path.

If you know the destination of an old highway that no longer suits you (a limiting belief you have identified), it‚Äôs time to steer away from that highway by taking the new path you‚Äôve chosen (positive affirmation) again and again. This path will eventually become, too, a beautiful expressway, while the old one, no longer used, will be overtaken by vegetation, allowing for the emergence of a new sense of identity and a renewed self-perception.

Listen to this audio for 21 days as much as you can, at least once a day, and repeat the phrases out loud during moments of silence. Say the phrases with the conviction that they are true. Feel that you are already what you want to become. Feel gratitude for this limitless being that you are.

To strengthen the imprint of these affirmations in your nervous system ‚Äì these new beliefs YOU have chosen to reach your goals ‚Äì move your body and contract your muscles. These are not just affirmations: these are Powerful Declarations. Find the Energy of Conviction within yourself. Feel what this new truth awakens in you: sensations, emotions, and images. This exercise transforms your thoughts, therefore your vibration, and consequently your actions, attracting the experience you‚Äôve chosen. Integrate visualization into this practice to amplify its effect.

Your brain does not distinguish between imagination and reality. If you imagine your favorite dish, you‚Äôll salivate. If you imagine joyful situations, you will truly feel happy. Imagination allows you to change your vibrational state.

To change your vibration even more powerfully, you must go beyond words. When you listen to your affirmations and repeat them out loud, visualize yourself living these affirmations. Use your imagination to live them fully and feel them. The more you experience your affirmations through imagination, the more you change your vibration, attracting the real-life experience. To help you, focus on your 5 senses: what do you see, feel, hear, touch, taste?
